channel.title: Cisco on Dean Tognolini Tech
channel.description: Recent content in Cisco on Dean Tognolini Tech

item.title: Configuring Flexible NetFlow on a Cisco Device
item.description: – Flexible NetFlow is as the name states, a more flexible version of NetFlow. Flexible NetFlow gives us more granular control over the traffic flows that we want to see and what information we want to pull out of those flows.

item.title: Configuring NetFlow With Solarwinds Network Traffic Analyzer
item.description: – NetFlow is used to collect information about traffic flows in your environment, this information is exported to a NetFlow analyzer which converts the raw data into human readable formats such as graphs, charts and tables.

item.title: Configuring Traditional NetFlow on a Cisco Device
item.description: – NetFlow is used to collect information about traffic flows in your environment, this information can be exported to a NetFlow analyzer which converts the raw data into human readable formats such as graphs, charts and tables.

item.title: Cisco WGB Bridging Table Issue
item.description: – The Issue I had an issue on a recent project where I had a WGB-client directly connected to Gi0 on a Cisco IW3702 WGB that I wanted to be in VLAN200 so I configured the workgroup-bridge client-vlan 200 command, therefore the MAC address for this WGB-client should be in bridge-group 200 (BG200).

item.title: Cisco WGB Debugging Data Rates
Cisco WGB Debugging Uplink
Cisco WGB Multiple VLAN Configuration
item.description: – These Cisco WGB configurations enable support for WGB-clients in different VLANs. In this deployment I have two VLANs: VLAN100 is for device management such as the AP BVI interfaces.

item.title: SNMPv3 on a Cisco Device
item.description: – Simple Network Management Protocol version 3 introduces much needed security features to the SNMP protocol, SNMPv1 and v2c do not support authentication or encryption of SNMP data. SNMPv3 introduces authentication based on the HMAC-MD5 and HMAC-SHA algorithms, and encryption using AES algorithms (weaker algorithms are also supported).
